newsitem.title: HONG KONG: China Star says to place 302 mln new shrs.
newsitem.headline: China Star says to place 302 mln new shrs.

text.p: China Star Entertainment Ltd said it would issue 302.4 million new shares to its controlling shareholder Dorest Co Ltd at HK$0.2946 each after Dorest places the same amount of existing shares at the same price.
The new shares represent about 9.09 percent of the company's enlarged share capital. The deal is expected to be completed on March 4, China Star said in a statement.
Dorest's shareholding in China Star will be reduced to 38.05 percent from 41.85 percent on completion of the deal, it said.
Kim Eng Securities (Hong Kong) Ltd is the placing agent.
China Star said net proceeds from the new share issue would amount to HK$86.5 million.

About HK$20 million will be used to finance a joint venture for the production of digital video discs in China and HK$50 million to acquire distribution rights for action films produced by Hollywood producers, it said.
It said about HK$16.5 million would be used to establish representative offices in China to strengthen its distribution network and for general working capital.
China Star produces and distributes film and karaoke laser discs and videotapes.
Its shares rose HK$0.015 to HK$0.34 on Thursday.
